Recap: Jeffrey realizes that Dinah is up to something but it's too late to stop her. Meanwhile, Cassie and Edmund are still busy trying to make a baby. Sebastian finds Holly passed out in her jail cell. Sebastian decides that he needs to take care of Holly. Bill rushes to the airport to change Olivia's mind. After much discussion, Olivia and Bill head home.
Transcript: Sebastian: Holly?
Holly: Who else? What a surprise.
Sebastian: Well, it shouldn't be. I told you I'd be back.
Holly: You also threw in that I might die here on my own. And then I heard you collapse on my trusty radiophone.
Sebastian: So, what? You thought I was dead?
Holly: Maybe, maybe not. But the door was still locked.
Sebastian: Well, I'm here now, so you're not alone anymore.
Holly: Oh, good. Then everything is all right. (Laughs bitterly)
Sebastian: Well, I hope so, because that's what I want. That's why I've done everything I've done.
Holly: (Laughs)
Sebastian: What? What's funny?
Holly: You, me, this whole gothic novel situation. I mean, all this trouble, for what? We're both going to die here, right, so nothing really matters.
Sebastian: No. You matter. The fact that you and I are both still here, in this moment, matters.
Holly: If you say so! (Laughs)
Sebastian: Holly? My God. Are you drunk?
Holly: (Laughs)
[SCENE_BREAK]
Bill: Olivia! Olivia!

Olivia: Bill. I will always remember our honeymoon at the beach. It was an incredible gift; on top of everything you've already given Emma and me. I just can't stay here. You deserve to be happy and free, and so do I, and neither of us will be if I stick around, because this whole town is going to think I killed Phillip. Your life will be made hell right along with mine, and that's the last thing I want for you. So I have to say good-bye. Good luck. And thanks for the snow. It was a really nice touch, your partner, Olivia.

Olivia: Hi. She asleep?
Nanny: Yeah.
Olivia: Listen, I'm sorry I'm late. I got a little tied up. Have they called the flight yet?
Nanny: 15 minutes ago. I thought you changed your mind.
Olivia: No. Emma and I are going to San Cristobal tonight. I'm not looking back. (Cell phone ringing) Excuse me.
Bill: Olivia? Olivia? Olivia, are you there? Answer me.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Cassie: No, no, no, no. See, this is not how we're supposed to do this.
Edmund: We've been together how long, and now you tell me?
Cassie: No, I don't mean that, Edmund. I just... I'm not going to be ovulating for a couple more days, and if we want to make a baby, this is just not the right time.
Edmund: So we should wait.
Cassie: Just a couple more days.
Edmund: Okay.
Cassie: So that's it? You're just going to stop?
Edmund: Well, if the timing's not right, I can wait if you can.
Cassie: I can wait.
Edmund: Good. All right then, we'll wait.
Cassie: That's long enough.
Edmund: Yeah. Let's go.

Jeffrey: Wait a minute, wait a minute.

Jeffrey: I need to get something.

Jeffrey: What?
Dinah: This ought to do the trick.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Sebastian: This is not what I wanted.
Holly: (Gasps) Isn't it funny how our plans get all screwed up? I mean, look at me, for instance. I planned to stay sober.
Sebastian: Why couldn't you have just waited until I returned? I told you I was going to be back soon.

Holly: Oh, maybe I didn't believe you. Or maybe I did, and I thought you were dead. Or maybe I just gave up hope. Anyway, I figure if I am going to die, I am going to have one last little binge-a-roonie.
Sebastian: No, Holly, Holly, you're not dead, okay?
Holly: Not yet. But let's look on the brighter side. I'm still kicking, and the party's going to start over again, so why don't you get me a couple of these?
Sebastian: No. No. No. Not even if this was it, if this was the end for us, I wouldn't do that. And I wouldn't have you waste our precious last moments together staring into the bottom of a glass.
Holly: Oh, Sebastian. You're no fun. What's the matter? Don't you like seeing me like this?
Sebastian: No. No, I don't.
Holly: Next time, you leave me a case or two of wine, vodka, whatever you've got, and you go to Africa and you find your cure, and you just take your time.
Sebastian: You know what? I am running out of time, Holly, and I just... damn it, I just wish you would have waited until I returned, just trusted me enough not to...
Holly: I wish you'd trusted me enough not to lock me inside my cage!
Sebastian: Coffee. Coffee. You need coffee.
Holly: Great. Then I'll be drunk and wide-awake.
Sebastian: Do you have any idea how much more difficult this is going to be now? But I can do this, okay? I can get you through this.
Holly: Why? Why do you bother? Why do you care?
Sebastian: Because I do.

Bill: Olivia, are you there? Answer me. Olivia, I know you're there. Just don't do this. You can't just... you can't just disappear. Just tell me where you are.

Edmund: Cassie, if it happened once, it can happen again. The key here is perseverance, and I, for one, plan on pressing the issue.

Edmund: I promise you, when the time is right, I will rise to the occasion. Come here.

Edmund: Cassie. Cassie, listen, if our having sex is all part of some doctor- prescribed baby-making regimen, then for best results, I think we need to be good patients and apply ourselves fully. Throw ourselves into this body and soul.

Edmund: You guess. I'll give you a hint.

Dinah: What are you thinking?
Jeffrey: Oh, just, you know, how many times we've done this.
Dinah: Hm. You still seem to enjoy it.
Jeffrey: Yeah, well, you know, it has its moments, doesn't it?
Dinah: Mm-hmm.
Jeffrey: And you certainly came prepared to enjoy yourself.
Dinah: Yeah. It's 2004, Jeffrey. I mean, you know, I'm a modern woman. Women carry condoms in their purses all the time, just in case.

Dinah: You can't be too careful these days.

Jeffrey: Defective, is it? Yeah. What's this? Huh? Does this come in handy, huh? "Just in case?"
Dinah: You know it's really cool of you to be going through my stuff.
Jeffrey: Pinholes on both sides, huh? That means what's inside must have holes in it, too. Trying to get pregnant, are we?

Sebastian: I hate seeing you like this.
Holly: You ain't seen nothing yet.

Sebastian: It doesn't have to be that way, Holly.

Holly: What was I supposed to do? You left me here. And I thought I was going to die in here. I thought I would never see anybody that I cared about anymore. I heard Blake on that... that radio thing, and I screamed. She couldn't hear me. And you, who promised me to come back, I hear you collapse on the phone, and I figure that's it. This is all I get. I'm going to die in here. So I thought I would just stop feeling anything. You know how it is.
Sebastian: No. It's not the same.
Holly: You thought you cared about me, but you lock me up in here? You leave me here? You drive me to drink, and now you act like I've done something to you!
Sebastian: This isn't you.
Holly: How do you know? You don't know me.
Sebastian: Yes, I do.
Holly: You don't know anything.
Sebastian: You can't be this way.
Holly: Why not?
Sebastian: Because, Holly, I... I brought you here to be here.

Holly: You brought me here. Why? You brought me here to what? You brought me here to live up to some perfect image of Holly in the pictures, Holly in Roger's stories? You brought me here to what? To save you? Well, I'm sorry, man. I can't even save myself.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Dinah: Look, Jeffrey, I don't know what you think you saw.

Jeffrey: Mothers usually give the fathers a say in the matter, and my say is, I don't want a baby, especially not with you.

Dinah: You know something? You are ego! You are pure ego! Why would you think that I am just so unbelievably attracted to you that I would have to have your child? You know what, Jeffrey? You're safe. I don't want you.
Jeffrey: Just what I can give you, is that it?
Dinah: Yeah. Yeah. I want a baby. I want something to love that will love me back unconditionally.
Jeffrey: Get a cocker spaniel.
Dinah: You are so cynical. It's not like this is going to affect you.
Jeffrey: What?

Dinah: From now on, I don't want your involvement. I don't want your support. I don't want anything. I wasn't even going to tell you that you were the father of this child until you found that stupid wrapper. I am going on this alone.
Jeffrey: Alone? Well, biology news flash, Dinah: You don't make a baby alone, okay? There's two people involved, and I don't want to be the sperm donor!
Dinah: You are too late. You're too late, buddy, because I got a good, warm feeling that this mission is accomplished.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Bill: Please tell me that Olivia is in the ladies' room changing Emma.
Nanny: No, they left.
Bill: What do you mean they left? What flight are they on?
Nanny: I don't know.
Bill: Just tell me. Where did they go?
Nanny: I can't.
Bill: Why not?
Nanny: Olivia was afraid you'd come after them.
Bill: Jane, I'm her husband. I'm going to find out whether she went whether you clue me in or not, so please just tell me where she went.
Olivia: You forgot her ear medication. I thought she might be uncomfortable on the flight without them, so I got her some more.
Bill: Flight to where?
Olivia: Give me that.
Bill: Jane, would you please just give Emma these eardrops? Come here.
Olivia: What?
Bill: Come here. I need to talk to you without any distractions. Jane, would you please just give us a couple of minutes? You didn't say good-bye.

Olivia: All right, fine. Good-bye.
Bill: Hold it hold it.

Sebastian: Drink it, careful, careful. You don't even realize what you are do you?

Holly: Well, I'm sorry to burst your bubble, but I'm nobody's caretaker. I am a mess, in case you haven't noticed.

Sebastian: Nobody wants to die alone, Holly. Nobody wants to die without someone.

Cassie: Now I'm exhausted.

Cassie: You make it sound like a lab experiment.

Cassie: Yeah.
Edmund: Then again, so is the fact that you seem to be interested in diving into my gene pool.
Cassie: Stop it, okay?
Edmund: Stop what?
Cassie: Stop tearing yourself down.
Edmund: Come on, Cassie. Half a year ago, the entire world thought I was Vlad the Impaler.
Cassie: I don't. And I don't care what anyone else thinks. But you bring it up, I ran into Jonathan the other day at Reva's.
Edmund: What happened?
Cassie: He was needling me about us having a baby, and how it could turn out to be just like him.
Edmund: Well, Cassie, it could be like me, too. It's in the genes.

Cassie: Our kid could be anything, Edmund--good, bad, or anything in between. What I do know is that our child is going to be loved and valued and taken care of, every single day of his or her life. That's what's important.

Edmund: Here's what I know. I know the only thing I'm really looking forward to is spending the rest of my life with you, loving you and your children and whatever other children we happen to have along the way, because the only thing I'm certain of is, I'm the luckiest man in the world.

Dinah: I just want what everybody else has.

Jeffrey: Well, does the baby deserve to have you? Do you ever think about that? This is a strange, foreign notion to you, but think about someone else besides yourself, just for one minute, okay?
Dinah: Jeffrey, I would make a great mother.

Jeffrey: How? Why? Don't answer that, okay? I don't want to know. I'm not interested.

Dinah: They haven't made one yet, and we can stop them.
Jeffrey: Oh, I get it. This is all part of your pathological competition with Cassie, isn't it?
Dinah: No.
Jeffrey: You know, you need help, Dinah. You need serious help. Why don't you get some?

Jeffrey: Oh, and what big piece of the puzzle am I missing here?
Dinah: You.
Jeffrey: Excuse me?

Jeffrey: What chance are we talking about here, Dinah?
Dinah: Your chance to have Cassie.
Jeffrey: My chance to have Cassie. Would you listen to yourself for one second? Next time you see the shrink, make sure he gives you a prescription for something very strong, all right?

Dinah: Jeffrey. Jeffrey, don't dance around this. Come on. You want her. You know it, and I know it. And once Cassie and Edmund get married and have a child, no one will be able to come in between them, not anymore.

Jeffrey: You know, first you're obsessed with having a baby of your own, and now you're obsessed with preventing Cassie from having a baby. Well, you know what, Dinah? As far as the first obsession is concerned, I'm going to go with the odds and believe that you're not pregnant. And besides, I don't want to be the father of your own little personal bundle of Mommy-love, okay? And as far as the second obsession is concerned, I told you before: Stay clear of Cassie and Edmund. Dinah: Are you sure about that? Because tonight, when you slept with me, it seemed like that was exactly what you needed. I felt it. You wanted to forget that I wasn't Cassie.
Jeffrey: Get out.

Cassie: Okay, tomatoes, lettuce, ham, swiss, turkey.

Cassie: No, he just wanted to remind me that we still had some more tests to take.

Cassie: Well, I think when we go back into the laboratory that you need to rest, because he wants us back into his office as soon as possible.
Edmund: For what? More tests?
Cassie: Mm-hmm. And this time it's your turn.

Olivia: I suppose you're going to tell me why.

Olivia: Well, thanks for the vote of confidence. Good-bye.
Bill: Look, it's not that I'm not worried about you. And yes, your note probably got it right. Most of the people in this town think you're guilty.

Bill: It's not going to happen.

Bill: Because I just do.

Olivia: More than my own life. You know those people. They don't stop until they get what they want, and what they want right now is Emma, okay? So I have to get out of here while I still have the chance. Besides...
Bill: Besides what? I mean, what else are you running from?
Olivia: You.

Olivia: Yeah. You've been hit again and again. You deserve a break, Bill. You deserve a better life.

Bill: Is that it? Yeah? Hm.
Olivia: Look, this is your chance to start over, without any strings or baggage or responsibility, so I'm letting you go. I'm letting you go forward.

Sebastian: No. No. No. You need rest, okay?
Holly: I thought you cared so much about me.
Sebastian: I'm not going to let you waste your life.

Bill: Will you please just let me explain?
Olivia: Sure.

Olivia: Really?
Bill: Really. Like, I couldn't use the carpool lane anymore, you know, with you gone.
Olivia: Well, that would be a tragedy.

Olivia: I was wondering who that leopard print belonged to.

Dinah: Because Cassie and Edmund are completely wrong for one another, and what I know proves it, and it will prove it to Cassie, and could send her straight to you.
Jeffrey: All right. That's enough.

Dinah: You've been waiting for Cassie to come to you on her own, but she hasn't. And maybe you don't have a plan to gain your heart's desire, but I do. You let me get what I want here, and I promise you, you will wind up with what you want as well. This is a golden opportunity, your last one. Okay, the time, it's ticking. It's now or never, and Jeffrey, that is reality.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Next, on "Guiding Light"...
Alan: You're loyal to that man and to his family after all they have done to us?
Gus: Dad, just come on, let's go. Let's get out of here.
Alan: No, no. You know something, Gus? You are a traitor to your own family!
Jonathan: You've got to tell me. Is there something in the water here in Springfield? Because the older women are so hot.
